intro: Pentacalia magnusii, commonly known as the Magnusii pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
